decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Location Plan, A(00)002, A(00)003 REV.A, A(00)004 REV.A, A(00)005 REV.A, A(00)006 REV.A, A(09)002 REV.A, A(09)003 REV.A, A(09)004 REV.A, A(09)005 REV.A, A(09)006 REV.A, A(09)007 REV.A
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Extract and arrestment plant for fumes/smell/steam from swimming pool

Prior to the installation of a swimming pool, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the installation, operation, and maintenance of a suitable arrestment plant and extract system for chemical smells, fumes and steam. Approved details shall be implemented prior to such use of the development and thereafter be permanently maintained and retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by fumes, smoke, smell or other emissions, in accordance with Policies policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D6, D14 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021).
| Anti- vibration mounts and silencing of machinery etc.

Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
description: Conversion of garage into habitable space; insertion of a window in lieu of the garage door opening; first floor side extension; alterations to front porch; rear roof extension, incorporating two Juliet Balconies; installation of two rooflights to front roofslope and a rooflight to side roofslope; alterations to fenestration to front, rear and side elevations involving insertion of new windows and a door; window replacement and roof tiles; landscaping works including excavation to provide a swimming pool in rear garden; and alterations to front boundary wall and gates
